Comment: Settling Mars needs to be an afterthought. All the time and resources spent sinking a bunch of mass into the bottom of another planetary gravity well would go much further building habitats and infrastructure in/on/around the moon, our Lagrange points, and the asteroids and other rocky/icy bodies that are nearby.  After that, the asteroid belt is the next logical place, followed by some of Jupiter's moons. Mars *might* be tied for third place, but realistically once we're living in space there wouldn't be much point.  Research outposts and vanity projects aside, settling Mars within a meaningful time frame doesn't have much an argument for it.
